@ Commands
you may also use the / instead of @
Squelch / filter channels are as follows:
Speech, Tell, Combat, Magic, Emote, Appraisal, Spellcasting, Allegience, Fellowship
@a <message> Use this command to speak to your allegiance. Text will appear in orange in your chat window.
@advancedsquelch Lists full squelch options
@advancedunsquelch Lists full unsquelch help
@allegiance, <message> The monarch and his or her speaker can broadcast allegiance-wide messages to everyone in the allegiance. Each of these persons is limited to three broadcasts per day. The monarch cannot get around this limit by appointing a new speaker -- the new speaker “inherits” the number of broadcasts that the old speaker made. 
@allegiance ban Bans a member from an allegiance
@allegiance ban list Lists the players banned from an allegiance
@allegiance boot –account [character] Bans a member from an allegiance
@allegiance broadcast [text] This command can be used instead of @allegiance, <message>
@allegiance chat kick [character] (,[reason]) Bans a member from allegiance chat
@allegiance officer add/remove [character] Adds or removes officers from an allegiance
@c <message> Allows Players to chat with their patrons and all of their patrons' other vassals (their co-vassals) 
@chat on Toggles whether you receive normal chat. When set to off, you will no longer receive any spoken speech (normal chat). However, you will still receive tells.
@chat off Toggles whether you receive normal chat. When set to off, you will no longer receive any spoken speech (normal chat). However, you will still receive tells.
@consent clear Removes all players from your consent list. You cannot loot any person's corpse until they @permit you again.
@consent off  Turns off the ability for you to accept permissions from players.
@consent on Turns on the ability for you to accept permissions from players.
@consent remove <player> Removes a specific player from your consent list. You can no longer loot that player's corpse.
@consent who Lists in the text box all players whom you have permission to loot.
@corpse Displays the location of your last outdoor death. Even if your corpse has disappeared or if you have subsequently died indoors, typing this command will display your last outdoor corpse location.
@day Toggles your outdoor world view to a brighter state and back to normal.
@deaths Tells you how many times your character has died. Removed during Waking from the Abyss.
@e Used to emote some text
@em Used to emote some text
@emote Used to emote some text
@f <message> Sends a broadcast to your Fellowship
@fillcomps Fills the buy list with all of the desired components.
@fillcomps <component type> Fills the buy list with all of the components of the given type.
@fillcomps <pyreal value> Fills the buy list with all of the components until the total price of the components exceeds the given value.
@fillcomps <component type> <pyreal value> Fills the buy list with all of the components of the given type until the total price of components exceeds the given value.
@filter  This command by itself will list all the filters currently in place.
@filter [-message_type]  Filters out all incoming messages of a specific type.  Example: "@filter -spellcasting" will filter out all spellcasting text, and "@filter -appraisal" will stop all "failed to assess you" messages. (see valid types at top)
@font default Returns all font settings to the default.
@font size <number> Set the pixel height of the font used in the chat window (default is 15).
@font <name> Sets the name of the font family used by all UI elements (default is Times New Roman).
@font Display the currently selected font.
@filter all Filters out all incoming messages of all types.
@framerate Use this command to show/hide frame rate in the top left corner of your screen.
@friends Tells you when friends log in.
@friends [search pattern] List everyone on your friends list that matches the search pattern. Wild cards are allowed.
@friends add <name> Adds a character to your friends list
@friends remove <name> Removes a character from your friends list
@friends remove all Remove everyone from your friends list.
@help Displays the common @commands in game.
@help allegiance chat  Lists all the Allegiance chat related commands.
@help chatting Lists chat and fellowship commands.
@help consent Lists the commands to display and manage your corpse-looting consent list.
@help fillcomps Lists all the @fillcomps commands
@help filters Lists the commands to filter out different kinds of incoming messages.
@help friendslist  Lists the commands to manage your friends list.
@help emotes Lists the commands to perform text and action emotes.
@help house Lists the commands for house, guest, and storage management.
@help permit Lists the commands to give others permission to loot your corpse.
@help squelching Lists the commands to squelch other players.
@help status Lists the commands that show your age, birthdate, current location, corpse location, and that allow you to kill your character.
@house abandon Abandon your house
@house add_allegiance Adds your allegiance to the guest list.
@house alleg_recall Teleports you to your allegiance villa or mansion.
@house available Lists cottages, villas and mansions that are available to purchase.
@house boot [character name] Removes a player from the house
@house boot all removes all players from the house
@house close Creates an open house [sic]
@house guest add [character name] Modifies the house guest list
@house guest list Shows the current guest list
@house guest remove [character name] Modifies the house guest list
@house guest remove_all Removes all guests from the house guest list
@house hooks off Makes the hooks in your house invisible.
@house hooks on Makes the hooks in your house visible.
@house mansion_recall Teleports you to your allegiance villa or mansion.
@house open Creates an open house
@house recall Teleports you to your house
@house remove_allegiance Removes your allegiance from the guest list.
@house storage add [character name] Modifies house storage permissions
@house storage add_allegiance Modifies house storage permissions for allegiance
@house storage remove [character name] Modifies house storage permissions
@house storage remove_allegiance Modifies house storage permissions for allegiance
@house storage remove_all Removes all storage permissions from guests
@index Use this command to see a list of advocates currently on duty in a specific town. 
@lifestone Formerly allowed you to "commit suicide". Now you may use this command to return to the last lifestone you attuned yourself to with no penalty.
@list <town name> List the advocates in or immediately near the town you are in.
@loc Displays the coordinates of your current position
@log If you are currently copying the text in your chat window to a logfile, this command will stop the process.
@log <name> Echoes chat text to a logfile. All the information that appears in your chat window after you type this command will be copied into a text file. Choose the file you are copying to by naming it in the command. If this file already exists, it will add the additional text to the end of it. To turn off logging, simply retype @log.
@log AClog.txt Echoes chat text to a log file named Aclog.txt in your Asheron's Call directory. After you use this command, all the information that appears in your chat window will be written to a file in your Asheron's Call directory named Aclog.txt.
@logopolis Opens a game of Pong. [No longer in the game.]
@m <message> Sends a broadcast to your Monarch
@marketplace Transports you to the marketplace
@me Used to emote some text
@message_types Lists all the squelchable message types 
@messagetypes Lists all the squelchable message types
@motd Displays the Monarch's message of the day to allegiance members
@motd clear Allows the monarch to clear the MOTD.
@motd set <message> Sets the Monarch's message of the day (MOTD) that their allegiance members can view at any time. 
@mr Autoreplaces with @t <name of the last follower who sent you an @m message>
@msg_types Lists all the squelchable message types
@msgtypes Lists all the squelchable message types
@notell on Toggles whether you receive @tells. When set to on, you will not receive any tells. Admins and Advocates will still be able to @tell you.
@notell off Toggles whether you receive @tells. When set to on, you will not receive any tells. Admins and Advocates will still be able to @tell you.
@p <message> Sends a broadcast to your Patron
@permit add <name> Allows you to give another player permission to loot one of your corpses.
@permit remove <name> Allows you to revoke permission from another player to loot one of your corpses.
@pklite Sets your status to Player Killer Lite (PK Lite).
@pr Autoreplaces with @t <name of the last vassal who sent you an @p message>.
@r <message> Sends some text to the last person who @tell'd you. Updated during The Madness of Men to autoreplace this with @t <name of the last player who sent you a tell> in the chat bar. Now, if you receive a tell from a second player while you are typing your reply, it will go to the correct recipient.
@render detail Turns on and off texturing for the landscape. Use this to change landscape texture and memory usage.
@render fov (# - between 90-180) Increase/decreases your field of view.
@render radius # (# - between 5 and 25) Change the distance that the landscape is drawn. The higher the number the greater the distance. Higher distances may contribute to choppy performance.
@reply <message> Sends some text to the last person who @tell'd you.
@retell <message> Sends some text to the last person you @tell'd. 
@rp <message> Sends some text to the last person who @tell'd you.
@rt <message> Sends some text to the last person you @tell'd. 
@say <message> Allows you to say something normally to those around you while you are talking on the fellowship channel
@sepaku Use this command to "commit suicide". This command will kill you instantly and return you to the last lifestone you attuned yourself to. You will lose your most valuable item, half your gold and incur a vitae penalty.
@speaker Shows players in an allegiance who the speaker for their allegiance currently is.
@speaker clear Removes the old speaker and promotes the new speaker to the office. The monarch may also remove the current speaker without setting a new one.
@speaker set <player> Designates a member of an allegiance to act as its speaker. There may only be one speaker at a time, and the monarch can set and change the speaker at any time using the command.
@squelch By itself, this shows the current list of squelched characters (max 32).
@squelch <character> Squelches all messages from a character.
@squelch -account <character> Squelches all messages from a character and also stops all non-public chat coming from the target's other characters.  Example: "@squelch -account Oswald" will squelch Oswald fully, and stop everything except public chat text from Oswald's other characters.
@squelch [-message_type] <character>  This will filter out text messages of type [message_type] from a specific character.  Example: @squelch -tell Smackphat.
@squelch -reply : This filters out all text messages from whoever last talked to you directly.  You may also use the -account flag and/or limit the squelch by indicating specific [-message_types]: @squelch -reply -account [-message_type]
Note: NPCs cannot be permanently squelched.
@t <message> Sends a private long-distance message to someone.
@tell <message> Sends a private long-distance message to someone.
@tell <your own name> You think, ...
@unfilter <-message_type> Removes filters on incoming messages of a specific type. For example, the following allows spellcasting text to resume: @unfilter -spellcasting.
@unfilter -all Removes filters on incoming messages of all types.
@unsquelch Lists the current list of squelched characters (max 32).
@unsquelch <name> Removes all squelches from a character, including account squelch.
@unsquelch <-message_type> <character> This allows messages of a certain type to come from a squelched character.For example this allows assessment messages from a character name Oswald: @unsquelch -assessment Oswald.
@unsquelch -reply <-account> <-message_type> This allows messages of a certain type from whoever last telled you.
@v <message> Sends a broadcast to your Vassals
@version Show the version number of Asheron's Call you are using.
